summary: The Frontline Fighter Force First Act focuses on prioritizing and accelerating the recapitalization of the U.S. Air Force's frontline fighter fleet. The bill mandates the Secretary of the Air Force to ensure the continued procurement of advanced fighter aircraft (F-16 variants, F-15EX, F-35, etc.) to replace legacy aircraft. It calls for a Government Accountability Office (GAO) review and reports to Congress on procurement challenges and progress, specifically mentioning the 335th operational squadron at Seymour Johnson Air Force Base. The bill emphasizes the importance of maintaining a strong fighter force for national defense.
